intro: Agalinis purpurea, commonly known as the purplestem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Agalinis purpurea is an annual plant that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
